page.title: 05THURSO RIVER AND HARBOUR
page.content: { Thurso's}growth by the side of the river was associated with the fishing, farming and flagstone industries. Though there are no commercial boats now in the river harbour there was a time when it was a busy estuary. Ships loaded Caithness Flagstone and carried it to all corners of the world and returned with many products including coal to heat the{Thurso homes and the nearby{Thurso Castle. The river is at present the centre of the local salmon fishing industry and in what is left of the old harbour are moored a number of boats owned by part-time fishermen. They fish in the summer for crab, lobster, cod, haddock and any other species of fish that they can catch. A fishing permit for{Thurso River}for salmon and trout is available for local and tourist alike.
